text: Edward Lebbaeus Breeden Jr. (January 28, 1905 – June 1, 1990) was an American lawyer and politician who served for many decades as a member of the Virginia General Assembly, first in the House of Delegates and later in the Senate. In 1970, he became the first formal majority floor leader of the Senate, after a move to reduce the power of the President pro tempore. ==References== ==External links== * * Category:1905 births Category:1990 deaths Category:Politicians from Norfolk, Virginia Category:Virginia Democrats Category:Virginia state senators Category:20th-century American politicians
title: Edward L. Breeden Jr.
